image.altText: Two men in dark suits and blue ties walk down North Terrace.

props.synopsis: Billions of dollars are being spent on early childhood education, skills and training, and infrastructure projects, but for many voters, current challenges like the rising cost of living and the housing shortage are likely to be at the forefront of their minds. So, has the latest budget done enough to address the state's problems?

title.children: SA premier looks to the 2030s, but does his latest budget do enough to address current problems?

image.altText: Former retail worker Hannah sits on the beach

props.synopsis: Retail workers are told "the customer is always right" but when they're dealing with leering, stalking and intrusive questions, a new study has found there are few places to turn for support.

title.children: 'I felt powerless': Retail employees say workplace sexual harassment is commonplace, confirmed as 'pervasive' in study

image.altText: Aerial shot of dozens of houses in neat rows in a new outer-suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: Industry experts say it's not time to ring the alarm bells over low building approval numbers, but the federal government's plan for 1.2 million homes by 2029 is definitely ambitious.

title.children: The latest building stats are in — here's what they say about the future of the housing crisis

image.altText: Man holding diet book.

props.synopsis: British TV doctor Michael Mosley has been reported missing after going on a coastal walk alone on the Greek island of Symi.

title.children: British TV doctor Michael Mosley missing in Greece after lone coastal walk

image.altText: Four older women chat over cups of tea with sandwiches on a table in front of them and ANZAC posters framed behind them.

props.synopsis: The number of Australians waiting for a home care package has increased to more than 68,000, with departmental officials conceding it is becoming harder to access the scheme.

title.children: More older Australians are wanting home care packages but are waiting longer for support

image.altText: Anthony Albanese at a press conference at Parliament House

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese says his cabinet is preparing "an offer" to put to the Australian people at the election. As it crafts its pitch, the biggest uncertainty is what sort of parliament a second term Labor government would likely face.

title.children: A minority government or President Trump: Uncertainty looms over Labor's promises to voters

image.altText: Composite image of Jess Sergis, Jessika Elliston, Shannon Mato and Millie Elliott in Women's State of Origin Game II.

props.synopsis: The players turn up in the clutch and fans turn up in the crowd as a thrilling Game II gives us a historic Women's Origin decider. Here are five quick hits from a sodden game in Newcastle.

title.children: Five quick hits: Maroons teen lays the platform as Brown gives us the decider we deserve

image.altText: King Charles reaches out from under a black umbrella canopy to wave at a crowd.

props.synopsis: The King's Birthday celebrations are happening this weekend. Here's a state-by-state breakdown of when you'll get a day off.

title.children: Millions of Australians have an extra day off next week. But it depends on where you live

image.altText: A boy looks amid grey rubble

props.synopsis: The Israeli military says Hamas militants were operating from within the Nuseirat school, while witnesses recount chaotic scenes as the injured are rushed to nearby hospitals.

title.children: Israeli strike kills at least 33 people at Gaza school that military claims was being used by Hamas

image.altText: Lightning and storm clouds over a town, lit up at night. There are three forks of lightning lighting the grey cloudy sky.

props.synopsis: A new industry is selling its services in Australia — weather forecasting using artificial intelligence and machine learning.

title.children: AI weather startups that claim they can forecast for an area the size of a football field now being used in Australia

image.altText: Hands hold SA budget papers.

props.synopsis: A relief package worth more than a quarter of a billion dollars is the centrepiece of this year's South Australian budget, which will fund $243 one-off payments to some concession holders — but debt is projected to hit $44 billion in the next few years.

title.children: SA Budget cost-of-living relief includes $243 payments, but opposition warns of 'debt bomb' — as it happened

image.altText: SA Treasurer Stephen Mullighan and Premier Peter Malinauskas

props.synopsis: The state government says this year's budget will focus on supporting South Australians who need it most as it pledges a $266.2 million cost-of-living package — while also keeping the budget in the black. Here's a look at the winners and losers of this year's budget.

title.children: Are you a winner or loser in this year's SA budget?

image.altText: AFL footballer celebrates a goal

props.synopsis: Adem Yze's young Tigers have found their roar once more, travelling to Adelaide on a five-day back-up to down the Crows by eight points in a thriller.

title.children: Tigers upset Crows in thrilling clash to record second win of the season in emphatic fashion

image.altText: An image of an industrial vehicle and a utility vehicle.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide man is arrested after police allege they found stolen items, including 20 shipping containers, horse buggies, four-wheel drives and numerous trucks at his property.

title.children: Police allege huge cache of stolen items, including shipping containers, 4wds and trucks, found at Adelaide man's home

image.altText: A man in blue top outside a court building. A woman looks on behind him

props.synopsis: Sang Van Huynh has pleaded guilty to two counts of causing serious harm by dangerous driving following a crash which injured two Marryatville High School students in Adelaide's eastern suburbs last year.

title.children: Truck driver changes plea to guilty over crash which injured two high school students

image.altText: A bald man in a police uniform stands in front of a police background.

props.synopsis: This week, Lois Witt became the seventh woman in Queensland to be violently killed by a man so far this year.

title.children: 'We should be ashamed': Queensland police respond to nearly 200,000 domestic violence incidents in 12 months

image.altText: Vasa Selupe smiles while standing in front of some trees.

props.synopsis: The first Pacific Engagement Visas will be granted in late 2024. Experts and community leaders welcome the scheme, but say the government needs to manage it carefully.

title.children: A new Pacific visa is expected to be a hit — but some warn it could bring challenges for the region

image.altText: A man in a suit with grey hair leans back and gestures as he speaks on a stage.

props.synopsis: Nine Entertainment chairman Peter Costello denies assaulting a journalist at Canberra Airport after The Australian posted footage that appears to show Mr Costello walking towards reporter Liam Mendes, who was asking him questions, before Mr Mendes falls backwards.

title.children: Nine chairman Peter Costello denies assaulting journalist at Canberra Airport

image.altText: An elderly couple sitting together, John wearing a green blazer and Terry in burgundy

props.synopsis: On Thursday, NSW became the last state to issue a formal apology on behalf of the government to people convicted of homosexual acts for laws and policies that "criminalised, persecuted and harmed" the LGBTQI+ community.

title.children: Terry was arrested twice for living freely as a gay man but feels 'lucky' to have survived outdated laws

image.altText: Marcia Neave still profile image against light

props.synopsis: Marcia Neave led the nation's first-ever royal commission into family violence. She has since labelled the government's response to reform as "simplistic".

title.children: 'Unspeakably terrible stories': Former commissioner Marcia Neave says there is more work to be done to combat gendered violence

image.altText: a woman in a blue jacket and grey beanie is standing outside with green hills and water behind her

props.synopsis: Justine Thompson has investigated crooks and crashes on Sydney's beat, but on remote Macquarie Island, halfway to Antarctica, she had 50-knot winds, orcas, major refuelling operations and people to manage.

title.children: From the Sydney police beat to a remote subantarctic outpost, station leader Justine returns from 'Jurassic Park'

image.altText: A man sitting in a chair looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's public education system has a lot of problems, and they seem to be getting worse with just over half of students finishing year 12. The state's only university is urging the government to find solutions now, before it's too late.

title.children: 'Barely above 50 per cent': Why Tasmania's plummeting school retention rate needs to be addressed urgently

image.altText: A woman addresses her team during a rugby league match

props.synopsis: The Maroons were playing against the odds in Women's State of Origin II but, like the best Queensland wins, they played as if it was them against the world and the world never stood a chance.

title.children: Queensland's against-the-odds victory is the stuff Origin legends are made of

image.altText: Wil Anderson, a 50-year-old man with grey hair pushed back, performs live on stage, his arms folded..

props.synopsis: Rhys Nicholson, Cameron James, Geraldine Quinn, Wil Anderson and Nath Valvo unpack why Australian comedy is making an unexpected turn towards the earnest.

title.children: In Australia's comedy scene, irony and sarcasm are out and warmth and optimism are in

image.altText: Ellie Carpenter has the ball between her legs with Lauren Hemp running behind her

props.synopsis: From 2026, women's football for club and country will look different. So, what exactly has FIFA done, and will it help grow the game?

title.children: Will FIFA's new match calendar help or hurt the women's game?

image.altText: Officer Cadets on parade at ADFA.

props.synopsis: Military data has revealed more than a third of female recruits reported sexual misconduct while attending the Australian Defence Force Academy in Canberra.

title.children: More than a third of female defence academy recruits report sexual misconduct

image.altText: Greens leader Adam Bandt holds his arms out wide while speaking with Anthony Albanese in the House of Representatives

props.synopsis: It might have felt good to land a few punches on the Greens, but in winning that parliamentary battle some in Labor fear they could lose the war in key seats at the next election.

title.children: In teaming up with the Liberals against the Greens, Labor may have won the battle but lost the war

image.altText: Current treasurer Jim Chalmers (left) and former treasurer Paul Keating (right).

props.synopsis: Jim Chalmers is the same age as Paul Keating was when he declared Australia was in "the recession we had to have". Is he doomed to tread the same path?

title.children: Australia's economy is beginning to look a lot like 1990. But there's one key difference

image.altText: Smoke plumes coming out from underneath a rocket.

props.synopsis: SpaceX's Starship rocket, designed to eventually send astronauts to the Moon and beyond, has undergone its fourth flight test.

title.children: SpaceX successfully launches Starship rocket to space on fourth test flight, survives re-entry which blew up last flight

image.altText: Joe Biden and Emmanuel Macron on D-Day in Normandy.

props.synopsis: US President Joe Biden and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy were among state heads who travelled to northern France to commemorate the 80th anniversary of D-Day.

title.children: World leaders come together on beaches of Normandy to commemorate D-Day

image.altText: A close up of Greg Lynn standing in front of a body of water near some rocks.

props.synopsis: Greg Lynn has taken the stand before a Supreme Court jury as he fights two murder charges over the deaths of missing campers Carol Clay and Russell Hill.

title.children: Greg Lynn apologises to families of Victorian campers as he gives evidence in murder trial

image.altText: Paige Hadley and Jamie-Lee Price hug a smiling Matilda Garrett

props.synopsis: Cash-strapped Netball Australia has been offered a fresh financial lifeline just weeks after the sport's governing body appointed Diamonds star Liz Ellis to its board.

title.children: Cash-strapped Netball Australia to receive funding, less than half of what was promised

image.altText: A close shot of Brereton, who is sitting in the offices of the new national anti--corruption commission

props.synopsis: The National Anti-Corruption Commission (NACC) has announced it will not pursue fresh corruption investigations into six public officials involved in the robodebt scandal.

title.children: Anti-corruption watchdog decides not to pursue Robodebt corruption investigation

image.altText: Two men in suits walk across a road.

props.synopsis: Canberra builder Brendan Howe, 35, pleaded guilty to four charges including the aggravated assault when his ex-wife was 34 weeks pregnant. Howe sent a letter of apology to the court, but Justice Louise Taylor said it showed no genuine remorse.

title.children: 'I am the boss': Canberra builder avoids jail for repeated assault of ex-wife, including while heavily pregnant

image.altText: A girl and a woman cross a road together, the girl wearing a black jumper over her head to hide her identify.,

props.synopsis: The Maroochydore District Court heard the teenager was one of three girls who lured the victim to a house before inflicting four hours of abuse.

title.children: 'Her parents have failed her': Teenager sentenced over torture of 13yo at Noosa
